title: Linux netstat Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the netstat command, a powerful network troubleshooting tool. Learn how to analyze network connections, statistics, and diagnose network issues on Linux systems.

meta.title: Linux netstat Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the netstat command, a powerful network troubleshooting tool. Learn how to analyze network connections, statistics, and diagnose network issues on Linux systems.
meta.keywords: netstat, network troubleshooting, network connections, network statistics, Linux, networking

steps.title: Understand the Purpose and Syntax of the netstat Command

verify.name: Verify netstat command usage
verify.hint: The `netstat -antp` command should display at least one network connection in the LISTEN state.

steps.title: Explore Network Connections Using the netstat Command

verify.name: Verify network connection exploration
verify.hint: The `netstat -antp` command should display at least one network connection in the LISTEN state and one in the ESTABLISHED state.

steps.title: Analyze Network Statistics and Troubleshoot Network Issues

verify.name: Verify network statistics analysis
verify.hint: The `netstat -s` command should display TCP statistics, and the `netstat -i` command should display network interface statistics for the `enp0s3` interface.
